place.name: WEST ASHBY
place.gazetteerText: ASHBY (West), a parish in Horncastle district, Lincoln; 2 miles N by E of Horncastle r. station. It contains the hamlets of Farthorpe and Middlethorpe; and its Post Town is Horncastle. Acres, 1,590. Real property, £4,853. Pop., 526. Houses, 118. Ashby-Thorpe House is a chief residence. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, £54. Patron, the Bishop of Carlisle. The church is later English. There are two Methodist chapels and some charities. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
